definition: when the melon is ripe, it falls (idiom); problems sort themselves out in the fullness of time
melon/gourd/squash
cooked (of food)/ripe (of fruit)/mature (of seeds)/familiar/skilled/done/also pr. [shou2]
variant of 蒂[di4]
stem (of fruit)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Mature love is like a living organism.
sentences.chinese: 瓜熟蒂落之爱就像一个有生命的机体。

sentences.english: This thing is going the distexcellentce.
sentences.chinese: 你看学习事情就这么瓜熟蒂落了。

definition: lit. where water flows, a canal is formed (idiom)/fig. when conditions are right, success will follow naturally
the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
to let nature take its course (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to be born/to come into being/to withdraw from worldly affairs
major achievement/great work/triumphant success
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
the meal is remembered long after the wait is forgotten/the good things in life are worth waiting for
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
effort will undoubtedly lead to success (idiom)
lit. prodigious abundance of fruit (idiom)/fruit hangs heavy on the bough/fig. countless accomplishments/one great result after another
heavily laden with fruit/fertile (of trees)/many noteworthy achievements
all we need is an east wind (idiom); lacking only one tiny crucial item
